#### Scope of Work

The Partnership Evaluation Division (Project Authority) within Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) is seeking the professional services of an Indigenous Consultant or a Consulting firm to evaluate the Indigenous Skills and Employment Training (ISET) Program.

### Services Required

The Consultant will be responsible for conducting a comprehensive evaluation of the ISET Program, including data collection and analysis. The evaluation will involve the implementation of diverse methodologies, including individual and group-based data collection methods.

### Data Collection Methods

The Consultant will be responsible for adapting the format of individual and group-based data collection methods to the needs of Indigenous partners, including:

* Key informant interviews
* Case studies
* Focus groups
* Storytelling and sharing circles
* Photovoice and/or video voice
* Culturally-adapted data collection methods

The Consultant will also be responsible for co-developing the evaluation methodology with Indigenous partners, following a distinction-based approach.

### Evaluation Report

The Consultant will be required to provide a comprehensive evaluation report that includes an analysis of the ISET Program, including its strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement.

#### Delivery and Method

The evaluation will be conducted in accordance with the requirements of the ESDC, and will be delivered in both English and French.
